name: Green and Resilient Retrofit Program
objective: The Green and Resilient Retrofit Program offers loans and grants for HUD-assisted multifamily properties to improve energy or water efficiency, enhance indoor air quality or sustainability, implement the use of zero-emission electricity generation, low-emission building materials or processes, energy storage, or building electrification strategies, or address climate resilience.
top_agency_name: Department of Housing and Urban Development
sub_agency_name: Assistant Secretary for Housing -- Federal Housing Commissioner
assistance_types: State (includes District of Columbia, public institutions of higher education and hospitals)
applicant_types: Private nonprofit institution/organization (includes institutions of higher education and hospitals)
Public nonprofit institution/organization (includes institutions of higher education and hospitals)

results.description: It is anticipated that 1,000 applications will be received and 525 awards will be made in Fiscal Year 2023

authorizations.text:
Inflation Reduction Act, 30002, IMPROVING ENERGY EFFICIENCY OR WATER EFFICIENCY
OR CLIMATE RESILIENCE OF AFFORDABLE HOUSING.. Pub. L. 117, 169.

rules_regulations: The NOFO will be published at the same time as a Housing Notice describing important program information for selected applicants.
